Ragnar raised an eyebrow. That girl was preparing something. He
promised himself to keep an eye out.

Ragnar: Well simply put, my scanners tell me you have some sort of
heartbeat, although it is not quite that. And I guess that you mean
something else by humans because in none of the recorded history has
there been an event of my kind meeting yours. Possibly, there has been
a warp through parallel universes when I came here.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 1/17/03 8:23:29 AM Central Standard Time, 
> wingedwarrior41@h... writes:
> 
> 
> > Ragnar looked at her as if she was insane.
> > 
> > Ragnar: I don't care why you do not like humans, but may I remind you
> > that you have a pulse on my scanners. Besides, I don't know how I got
> > to become as I am today.
> > 
> 
> She moved along with the 'human'. "Easy, human. I am a Decepticon. I
could 
> tell you stories of why. Plain & Simple, your kind were more than
annoyances &
>  pests. You actually TRIED to control my comrades more than once. A bad 
> decission." she paused, as she continued on. 
> 
> Then changed the subject. "What do you mean a pulse?" She looked
ahead, she 
> was trying to get her bearings. Something came into her memory core.
If this 
> was Prehistoric Earth, the the Ark.. was here! Her comrades in
stasis. & She 
> would orginially be on Cybertron, hunting down Elita 0ne & the
Fembots & 
> other Autobots. She would be in her first upgraded form. 
> 
> Upgrades... she wanted to get out of this bloody form now. She searched 
> internally. Difficult to find but she found it. it was a technology
she was 
> not very keen with. 
> 
> She opened a com back to the ship, to Wheeljack. "Wheeljack. May I
remind 
> you, that there are metals in the hold.. however, don't get so
greedy with 
> them. I will be using them."
